rows.text_1: Let’s check in on another family to see how talking about feelings helps them in a practical way:

rows.text_2:
@data.characters.f1_father.name: “@data.characters.f1_daughter_6.name, I have 5 minutes to spend One-on-One Time with you. What would you like to do?”
 @data.characters.f1_daughter_6.name: “Let’s play with the ball outside!”

@data.characters.f1_daughter_6.name: “I can’t do it!”
 @data.characters.f1_father.name: “I see that your hands are tight and you are speaking loudly. It looks like you are upset, @data.characters.f1_daughter_6.name. It’s not easy, let’s practise a little bit more. I know you can do it.”

@data.characters.f1_father.name: “Five catches in a row! You seem really proud to have made it to five, @data.characters.f1_daughter_6.name!”
 @data.characters.f1_daughter_6.name: “Let’s do 10!”
@data.characters.f1_father.name: “Well done, my girl. I am very happy to be able to spend this special time with you, @data.characters.f1_daughter_6.name.”

rows.text_1: Let’s reflect on what @data.characters.f1_father.name and @data.characters.f1_daughter_6.name did.
rows.quiz_1_option_1_text: To show @data.characters.f1_daughter_6.name he is paying attention
rows.quiz_1_feedback_1: That’s right. By naming @data.characters.f1_daughter_6.name’s emotions, @data.characters.f1_father.name models an important skill.
rows.quiz_1_option_2_text: To help @data.characters.f1_daughter_6.name learn to recognise her own emotions
rows.quiz_1_feedback_2: That’s right. By naming @data.characters.f1_daughter_6.name’s emotions, @data.characters.f1_father.name models an important skill.
rows.quiz_1_option_3_text: To show @data.characters.f1_daughter_6.name that her emotions are normal
rows.quiz_1_feedback_3: That’s right. By naming @data.characters.f1_daughter_6.name’s emotions, @data.characters.f1_father.name models an important skill.
rows.quiz_1_option_4_text: To help @data.characters.f1_daughter_6.name learn how to talk about her emotions
rows.quiz_1_option_5_text: To support and encourage @data.characters.f1_daughter_6.name to keep trying
rows.quiz_1_feedback_5: That’s right. By naming @data.characters.f1_daughter_6.name’s emotions, @data.characters.f1_father.name models an important skill.
rows.quiz_2_question: What can we learn from @data.characters.f1_father.name in how he talks about @data.characters.f1_daughter_6.name’s emotions?
rows.quiz_2_feedback_1: Yes, @data.characters.f1_father.name shows us how we can talk about positive *and* difficult emotions with our children in a helpful way.
rows.quiz_2_feedback_2: Yes, @data.characters.f1_father.name shows us how we can talk about positive *and* difficult emotions with our children in a helpful way.
rows.quiz_2_option_3_text: He uses words to describe @data.characters.f1_daughter_6.name’s emotions
rows.quiz_2_feedback_3: Yes, @data.characters.f1_father.name shows us how we can talk about positive *and* difficult emotions with our children in a helpful way.
rows.quiz_2_option_4_text: He shares his own feelings with @data.characters.f1_daughter_6.name
rows.quiz_2_feedback_4: Yes, @data.characters.f1_father.name shows us how we can talk about positive *and* difficult emotions with our children in a helpful way.
rows.quiz_2_feedback_5: Yes, @data.characters.f1_father.name shows us how we can talk about positive *and* difficult emotions with our children in a helpful way.
rows.quiz_3_question: What would have happened if @data.characters.f1_father.name had criticised or ignored @data.characters.f1_daughter_6.name’s frustration?
rows.quiz_3_feedback_1: Correct. Noticing and naming emotions is very important to support our children and help them learn new skills.
rows.quiz_3_option_2_text: The same problem would happen again next time
rows.quiz_3_feedback_2: Correct. Noticing and naming emotions is very important to support our children and help them learn new skills.
rows.quiz_3_feedback_3: Correct. Noticing and naming emotions is very important to support our children and help them learn new skills.
rows.quiz_3_option_4_text: @data.characters.f1_daughter_6.name would not have learned how to catch a ball
rows.quiz_3_feedback_4: Correct. Noticing and naming emotions is very important to support our children and help them learn new skills.
